Abstract: This study delves into the critical aspects of model diagnostics and forecast evaluation specifically tailored for quantile predictions. Utilizing advanced methodologies such as calibration, coverage plots, Murphy diagrams, and reliability diagrams, we aim to enhance the accuracy and reliability of quantile regression models. The research emphasizes the importance of scoring functions in assessing the predictive performance of these models, offering a comprehensive framework for evaluating their effectiveness. Through a series of empirical analyses, we demonstrate how these diagnostic tools can be effectively applied to identify model shortcomings and improve forecast precision. Our findings contribute to the broader field of statistical modeling by providing practitioners with robust techniques for quantile forecast evaluation, thereby facilitating more informed decision-making processes in various applications.
